trial_identification.studytitle: The role of Fallopian Sperm Perfusion in intrauterine insemination in improving pregnancy outcomes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Fallopian Sperm Perfusion versus intrauterine insemination for couples with unexplained infertility in improving pregnancy outcomes

interventions.interventions: Fallopian Sperm Perfusion - a technique of intrauterine insemination using a catheter with a balloon to reduce loss and also using 4 ml of insemination fluid with the sperm -to ensure that some of the sperm are in the fallopian tube. Only one cycle. It takes about 10 mins to complete.
interventions.comparator: intrauterine insemination involves insemination of the male partners semen directly into the uterine cavity. It only occurs at the time of ovulation usually about day 13 and 14 and it takes about 10 minutes to complete. Patients undergo treatment only once.

primaryOutcome.outcome: live birth rate - delivery after 24 hours of live born neonate.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: miscarriage - loss of pregnancy up to 24 weeks after a positive pregnancy test at 6 weeks

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: unexplained infertility more than one year

trial_design.concealment: computer generated sequence in serially numbered opaque sealed envelopes

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Room 51, Level 12, Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) Auckland City Hospital, Park Rd, Auckland 1042

fundingsource.fundingname: Auckland District Health Board A+ TRUST funded the cost of the catheters
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Private Bag Auckland District Health Board Auckland 1011

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To compare fallopian sperm perfusion with standard intrauterine insemination
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Farquhar, CM, Brown J, Arroll, N, Gupta D, Boothroyd CV, Bassam MH, Moir J, Johnson NP. A randomised controlled trial of fallopian tube sperm perfusion compared with standard intrauterine insemination for women with non-tubal infertility. Human Reproduction 2013; 9:2134-2139.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ministry of Health, Level 2, 650 Great South Rd, Penrose Auckland 1050
